marketNews.title: RI Targets 0% Tariff for Flagship Exports to the US
marketNews.content: The Secretary of the Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs, Susiwijono Moegiarso, stated that the government is pushing for a 0% tariff for a number of flagship export commodities to the US, such as CPO, coffee, cocoa, up to nickel. Susiwijono said that the commodities proposed to receive a 0% tariff are likely still subject to change because the final list has not been determined. In return, Susiwijono mentioned that US technology products will be exempt from the domestic content level (TKDN) rule. Susiwijono added that all US goods imported into Indonesia will not be subject to any tariffs, except for alcoholic beverages and pork. Several US goods will also be exempted from import quota regulations. Susiwijono is optimistic that a tariff agreement can be reached, especially for commodities highly needed by the US. Indonesia is the main supplier of CPO to the US, contributing 85% of total US CPO imports in 2024. Meanwhile, the US is the 4th largest destination country for Indonesian CPO exports, contributing approximately 7% of Indonesia's total CPO export volume in 2023. Previously, advisor to President Prabowo Subianto and member of the National Economic Council, Mari Elka Pangestu, told Bloomberg last week that after securing a 19% tariff, Indonesia will continue to negotiate with the US regarding sectoral tariffs, the purchase of Boeing aircraft, and critical minerals. Pangestu also explained that Indonesia will provide broader access for imports from the US that do not directly compete with Indonesian products, such as wheat and cotton.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: The success in lowering tariffs for the aforementioned commodities potentially has a positive impact on Indonesian exports, but not significantly, according to us. This is considering that the demand for Indonesia's two flagship commodities - CPO and nickel - is dominated by China (and also India for CPO). We assess that investors will still first focus - at least in the near future - on the domestic economic developments, especially the government's efforts to boost purchasing power recovery. Several recent economic indicator data - such as credit growth, car sales, and cement sales - indicate that the domestic economic conditions are still challenging.

marketNews.title: Other hot topics you need to know...
marketNews.content: 1. President Prabowo Subianto inaugurated the Red and White Village Cooperative (Kopdes) program on Monday (21/7). The Minister of Cooperatives, Budi Arie Setiadi, stated that currently there are about 80,500 established Red and White Kopdes, with 103 cooperatives among them to serve as pilot projects. Initial financing for the Red and White Kopdes will be disbursed through a special KUR (People's Business Credit) via state-owned banks (Himbara) with a ceiling of up to 3 billion Rupiah per cooperative. 2. The Minister of Communication and Digital, Meutya Hafid, stated on Saturday (19/7) that there are no plans to restrict basic video call or Voice Over Internet Protocol (VoIP) services. Meutya's statement came after a Director at the Ministry of Communication and Digital, Denny Setiawan, mentioned that they are studying the discourse to encourage the contribution of over-the-top services related to bandwidth capacity investment. 3. The Corruption Court Judge on Friday (18/7) sentenced Thomas Lembong to 4 years and 6 months in prison in the alleged corruption case of sugar imports at the Ministry of Trade during the 2015-2016 period, even though the judge stated that Lembong did not enjoy the results of the corruption crime committed. Lembong was charged with causing state financial losses of 578.1 billion Rupiah, among others, by issuing raw crystal sugar import approval letters to 10 companies without being based on inter-ministerial coordination meetings and without recommendations from the Ministry of Industry. Lembong himself was the former Minister of Trade during the 2015-2016 period under President Joko Widodo's administration and a campaign manager for presidential candidate Anies Baswedan in the 2024 election. 4. Chinese Premier, Li Qiang, on Monday (21/7) announced the start of construction for the world's largest hydropower dam on the east bank of the Tibetan Plateau. The US$170 billion project will feature 5 hydropower stations with a total electricity capacity of 300 billion kWh per year, equivalent to the amount of electricity consumed by the UK during 2024. 5. Bisnis reports that Vale Indonesia (INCO) will reschedule the agenda for changes in company management, including the appointment of a new President Director. This follows the failure to establish the EGM on July 18, 2025, due to not meeting the attendance quorum. Currently, the position of INCO President Director is still held in an interim capacity by Bernardus Irmanto, who replaced Febriany Eddy after she was appointed as Managing Director at PT Danantara Asset Management. 6. Perusahaan Gas Negara (PGAS) announced that it will hold an EGM on August 27, 2025, with the agenda of changing the company's management. Previously, PGAS announced in early July 2025 that the term of office for Director, Harry Budi Sidharta, had ended following his appointment as a director at PT Pertamina International Shipping. 7. Bukit Uluwatu Villa (BUVA) plans to hold a rights issue of up to 4.8 billion new shares, with a maximum dilution effect of 18.9%. The exercise price and ratio have not been announced, while the funds raised are intended for business development, capital expenditure, and/or settlement of company obligations. This plan will be discussed at the EGM on July 22, 2025. Previously, BUVA had announced a rights issue plan of up to 3.6 billion new shares scheduled for the EGM on March 24, 2025, but the plan was canceled because the company still needed time to review and finalize discussions with relevant parties.

tickerNews.title: Prajogo Pangestu Buys 3 Million BREN Shares for IDR 23.8 Billion
tickerNews.content: The controller of Barito Renewables Energy, Prajogo Pangestu, purchased 3 million BREN shares at an average price of 7,944 Rupiah per share on July 21, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 23.8 billion Rupiah. Following this transaction, Prajogo Pangestu's direct ownership in BREN increased from 0.10125% to 0.10349%.

tickerNews.title: Garuda Indonesia (GIAA) to Deliver Audited 2Q25 Financial Statements Amid Restructuring
tickerNews.content: Garuda Indonesia (GIAA) announced it will submit its 2Q25 financial statements after being audited by a public accountant, in line with the company's restructuring plan through a shareholder loan and capital injection from Danantara. GIAA stated that its subsidiary, PT Citilink Indonesia, will act as the obligor for the shareholder loan. Furthermore, GIAA announced that the loan will be converted into shares by Danantara, followed by a capital contribution to the company. GIAA also mentioned that the company plans to conduct a valuation by a public appraisal services office to determine the fair value of shares to be issued in the capital increase process. Previously, Danantara announced in June 2025 that it would provide a shareholder loan worth US$405 million or 6.65 trillion Rupiah to GIAA, where this loan is part of a financing support package designed to reach US$1 billion.

tickerNews.title: Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia (ACES) SSSG Contracts by -2.9% YoY in 1H25, Below Target
tickerNews.content: Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia (ACES) recorded a same store sales growth (SSSG) of -4.8% YoY in June 2025 (vs. May 2025: -4.6% YoY, June 2024: +8.7% YoY). This result led to a contraction in SSSG throughout 1H25 of -2.9% YoY (vs. 1H24: +10.7% YoY), below the 2025 target which seeks growth of over +1% YoY. During 1H25, SSSG slowed down across all regions, with Outside Java at -0.9% YoY, Java excluding Jakarta at -3.8% YoY, and Jakarta at -4.5% YoY.

tickerNews.title: Dayamitra Telekomunikasi (MTEL) Plans Buyback Up to 4.12% of Shares for IDR 1 Trillion
tickerNews.content: Dayamitra Telekomunikasi (MTEL) plans a buyback of up to 4.12% of its shares with a fund allocation of up to 1 trillion Rupiah. This plan will be discussed in the EGM on August 26, 2025, with the implementation period expected to run from obtaining shareholder approval until 12 months later.

tickerNews.title: Surya Semesta Internusa (SSIA) Records 13.1 Hectares Land Sales in 1H25; Subsidiary NRCA Books New Contracts Worth IDR 1.42 Trillion
tickerNews.content: VP of Investor Relations & Sustainability of Surya Semesta Internusa (SSIA), Erlin Budiman, told Kontan that SSIA recorded land sales of 13.1 hectares during 1H25 (vs. 1Q25: 7.6 hectares), equivalent to approximately 10% of the 2025 target of 137 hectares. The value of these land sales was not mentioned. Erlin also stated that the company's subsidiary, Nusa Raya Cipta (NRCA), recorded new contract value of 1.42 trillion Rupiah during 1H25, equivalent to approximately 38% of the 2025 target of 3.75 trillion Rupiah.

tickerNews.title: Adhi Karya (ADHI) Secured New Contracts Worth IDR 3.5 Trillion in 1H25, Equivalent to 12.5-14% of Target
tickerNews.content: Corporate Secretary of Adhi Karya (ADHI), Rozi Sparta, told Kontan that the company recorded a new contract value of 3.5 trillion Rupiah during 1H25 (-66% YoY), equivalent to 12.5-14% of the 2025 target of 25-28 trillion Rupiah. Based on the source, ADHI's new contracts during 1H25 originated from SOEs/Regional SOEs (33%), government (24%), private sector (20%), loans (15%), and the remainder from internal company sources.

tickerNews.title: Sinergi Inti Andalan Prima (INET) Controller Increases Ownership by ~0.24%
tickerNews.content: The controller of Sinergi Inti Andalan Prima (INET), PT Abadi Kreasi Unggul Nusantara, bought approximately 19.8 million INET shares at an average price of approximately 253 Rupiah per share on July 17, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 5 billion Rupiah. Following this transaction, the ownership of PT Abadi Kreasi Unggul Nusantara in INET increased from 64.35% to 64.59%.
